page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO NASH AREA
page.content: This area typifies the open rolling countryside of N.Bucks. It combines a mixture of picturesque villages and open farmland which, despite the proximity of Milton Keynes retains its rural character. The block takes in most of the Parish of Beachampton and of Nash and to the west, part of Thornton. The 2 villages of Nash and Beachampton show a pleasant combination of old and new dwellings, whose inhabitants mainly have to travel outside the area for work, education, health and other services. Car ownership is a necessity as public transport is almost non-existent. The 2 settlements have remained genuine village communities with old established families living alongside newcomers attracted to the area by Milton Keynes with all its amenities.
